T

tests(ArrayList<float[]>, ArrayList<float[]>) - Method in class neuralnet.GeneticAlgorithm
test all neuralNetwork (evaluate their fitness) then update the species update (you must call this method before using nextGen)
threshold - Variable in class neuralnet.GeneticAlgorithm
threshold value indicate how similar two network must be to be in the same species
toNeuronNetwork() - Method in class neuralnet.NeuralNetwork
 
toString() - Method in class neuralnet.GeneticAlgorithm
 
toString() - Method in class neuralnet.NeuralNetwork
Return a String containing informations about the neural network.
informations contain in this representation are : number of inputs number of output complete structure of the neural network experience learningRate
toString() - Method in class neuralnet.NeuronNetwork
return a complete representation of the Neural network
toString() - Method in class neuralnet.Perceptron
Return a String containing informations about the Perceptron.
informations contain in this representation are : number of inputs experience learningRate the used activation function
train(float) - Method in class neuralnet.Perceptron
train the Perceptron with its actual output.
The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
train(float[], float[]) - Method in class neuralnet.NeuronNetwork
test the neural network and add the result to the fitness value
train(Object[], float[]) - Method in class neuralnet.Perceptron
compute the Perceptron output then train it for every item of the array.
The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
train(Object[], float[], int) - Method in class neuralnet.Perceptron
compute the Perceptron output then train it X times with random input from the database.
The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
train(Object, float) - Method in class neuralnet.Perceptron
compute the Perceptron output then train it.
The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
train(ArrayList<float[]>, ArrayList<float[]>) - Method in class neuralnet.NeuronNetwork
test the neural network and add the result to the fitness value
train(ArrayList<float[]>, ArrayList<float[]>, int) - Method in class neuralnet.GeneticAlgorithm
do the same as above except it also train the network (so the algorithm don't wander randomly to find good weights through generation and can learn a bit with time)
